content.data: Enhanced Tool Selection Logic for CNC Output

The following represents 
 the automatic tool selection logic, which, the S2M Center employs when 
 parts are output to CNC and is organized by operation type. This, in part, 
 is made possible by the many properties that can be assigned to a particular 
 tool in the Tool Catalog. If you are unfamiliar with the properties 
 that can be assigned to particular tools in the Tool Catalog, it may be 
 best to review the information presented in the  Tool 
 Catalog Setup  topic in this help file before reviewing the information 
 below.

Part 
 Outline Operation   - See 
 Chart #6 at the end of this topic
Search tools for flat routers with Outline = True

If found then select tool 
	 in this order 
 
 Up 
		 / Down Shear bit that matches sheet requirements 
 Compression 
		 bit 
 Down 
		 Shear bit 
 Up Shear bit 
 Expansion 
		 bit (Up Shear & Down Shear = False) 
 
 No match 
 ERROR

Vertical Hole Operation   -

Search tools for vertical drill bit with exact size match

If found then select tool 
	 in this order

If found then select tool

If found then select tool 
	 in this order

Through 
		 bore setting matches hole requirements 1st drill with size match 
 Check 
		 if Drill Bit is in Gang Drill Head. 
 
 If found - Check 
			 if hold position is in gang drill head limits 
 
 If 
		 no match   WARNING   Search flat routers for size match 
 
 If found then select 
			 tool in this order to create hole in one drop 
 
 Down Shear bit 
 Compression bit 
 Up Shear bit 
 Expansion 
				 bit (Up Shear & Down Shear = False) 
 
 
 If 
		 no exact size match then search for flat router with diameter 
		 smaller than hole size 
 
 If found then select 
			 tool in this order to create pocket to match hole size

	 single path using router

If no size match then 
		 search for flat router with smaller diameter than dado width 
 If 
		 found and tool diameter is greater than or equal to  dado width 
		 then create 4-pass route using tool selected in this order

			 that matches sheet requirements 
 Down Shear bit 
 Compression 
			 bit

			 Shear & Down Shear = False) 
 Up Shear bit 
 
 If found and tool diameter 
		 <  dado width then create multi-pass route (starting from 
		 the outside and then moving inward concentrically) using tool 
		 in this order

Cutout 
 / Pocket Route Operation   - 
 See Chart #5 at the end of this topic

Search flat routers for size 
	 match and Up Shear / Down Shear match

Search flat routers for size 
	 match and Up Shear / Down Shear match

Search flat routers for size 
	 match and Up Shear / Down Shear match

If 
		 found then create single path using tool 
 If no size match 
		 then search for smaller diameter flat router with Up Shear / Down 
		 Shear match 
 
 If found and tool 
			 diameter is greater than or equal to  dado width then create 
			 4-pass route 
 If 
			 found and tool diameter <  dado width then create multi-pass 
			 route 
 
 If 
				 no match found then search for any flat router with smaller 
				 diameter then the route operation 
 If 
				 found and tool diameter is greater than or equal to  
				 dado width then select tool in this order to create 4-pass 
				 route
